full_summary:
**ERE : Arctic Cache Boom**
**PW-_ERD-017-29339**
**F7047-230025/A**

**Published on April 10, 2024 and Closing on April 24, 2024**

A Request for Proposal (RFP) has been issued to the supply market for the procurement of a containment boom in support of the Canadian Coast Guard. This procurement aligns with the Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA) and the World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO-AGP).

**Key Details:**

* Proposals are accepted in English or French, and must be submitted electronically to Buyandsell.gc.ca.
* Suppliers must hold a Supply Arrangement (SA) under the Request for Supply Arrangement (RFSA) F7047-220006/B.
* Delivery is required on or before March 2025.

**Important Deadlines:**

* The bidding process will close on April 24, 2024.
* Requests for debriefing must be submitted within 15 working days of notification of non-selection.

**Trade Agreements:**

This tender is subject to the following trade agreements:

* Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA)
* World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO-AGP)
* Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP)
* Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
* Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-UK Trade Continuity Agreement
* Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement

**Key Contacts:**

* Contracting Authority: Public Works and Government Services Canada
* Contact Information: Bruce Bates, (343) 598-1269, bruce.bates@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca

**Additional Information:**

The Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers. The requested delivery date is on or before March 2025. The debriefing may be provided in writing, by telephone or in person.

Note: The above text has been rewritten to make it clearer, more concise and easier to read. The original text has been reviewed and relevant information has been included, while unnecessary details have been omitted.  Mark-down format has been used for better readability.
